page.title: 05Education
page.content: There has been a school on the present site in Keig since 1862. It has been modernised several times and was rebuilt in 1963. The old combined primary and secondary school disappeared and in its placee arose a fine modern well appointed primary school. There are 2 classrooms, a hall/general purposes room with well appointed stage. There are also a staff room, indoor toilets and meals servery, the meals being carried in keep hot containers from the new kitchens at Alford Academy. There were 29 pupils in 1970, rising to 53 in 1974 and the roll has now fallen to 18 - 2 short of the figure which would re-instate a second teacher, lost in 1981 when for 2 months the roll went down to 9 pupils.
